intro: Scleria distans var. interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted umbrella sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowering spikes consist of small, three-lobed flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
